Create a Table of Topic Prevalence

Source: R/text_mining_functions.R
topic_probability_table.Rd

Given a tidy data frame of per-document per-topic probabilities (gamma), this function calculates the mean prevalence of each topic and returns a table of the top topics.

Usage

topic_probability_table(data, top_n = 10)

Arguments

data

A tidy data frame from tidytext::tidy(stm_model, matrix="gamma").

top_n

The number of topics to display, ordered by their mean prevalence.

Value

A tibble containing columns topic and gamma, where topic is a factor representing each topic (relabeled with a "Topic X" format), and gamma is the mean topic prevalence across all documents. Numeric values are rounded to three decimal places.

Examples

if (interactive()) {
  # Assume gamma_td is from tidytext::tidy(stm_model, matrix="gamma")
  # tbl <- topic_probability_table(gamma_td, top_n = 10)
  # print(tbl)
}
